channel.title: My First VB program: RS client
channel.description:
Ok, well this is my very first VB program. I am using VB 2005 Express. It is a runescape client. This client is very basic, it's just preety much a browser that only lets you go to runescape+ extra links like runehq google and draynor (there are more), and yes I do know that google will let you go to any sight you want. I just felt like putting it there for users who wana use it that way. It has a Back, Forward, Refresh, and Play Runescape button. This was all done by me (including the website it starts on) and I only used a VB book I got from the library today :P. Tell me how I did please :P.
Download: [url=http://rapidshare.com/files/81875201/setup_spikeys_client.exe.html]http://rapidshare.com/files/81875201/setup_spikeys_client.exe.html[/url]
SCAN:
[IMG]http://i104.photobucket.com/albums/m187/xspikeyhairx/scan.jpg[/img]

item.title: My First VB program: RS client
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Get a torrent for VB6, you’ll find it’s MUCH better than VB .NET. Just Google Visual Basic 6 Torrent, and then after to open the torrent, open Setup from the new folder, or else it won’t work right.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

Can you upload it to another site? Can’t download from that site.

[quote=“llib, post:8, topic:171667”]Instead of having a push button to play rs, why don’t you have it load the site on startup…?
/idea[/quote]Because he has a his own page for the startup…

item.title: My First VB program: RS client
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

If this is your first program, very nice. It’s simple, which is OK if you’ve never tried anything like VB before. Perhaps you should try having it parse the HTML on the runescape game page, and get it to hide the advert. I know .NET has some good methods for parsing and modifying HTML in the web browser control class, more specifically, WebBrowser.Document.
Good luck.

Read full topic
